entry.title: Partially Open Access Journal: Arctos: Acta Philologica Fennica - Reviews
entry.content:
Arctos: Acta Philologica Fennica - Reviews
Arctos is the principal classical journal of Finland. Published since 1954, it appears annually since 1974.

The Editorial Board of Arctos welcomes submissions dealing with any aspect of classical antiquity, and the reception of ancient cultures in mediaeval times and beyond. Arctos presents research articles and short notes in the fields of Greek and Latin languages, literatures, ancient history, philosophy, religions, archaeology, art, and society. Each volume also contains reviews of recent books.

All reviews published in Arctos since vol. 41 (2007) are available in PDF format on this page.

Reviews Published in Vol. 41 (2007)

  • A Handbook of Ancient Religions. Edited by John R. Hinnells, 2007. (Elina M. Salminen)
  • Greek and Roman Animal Sacrifice. Ancient Victims, Modern Observers. Edited by Christopher A. Faraone – F. S. Naiden, 2012. (Tua Korhonen)
  • Francesca Prescendi: Décrire et comprendre le sacrifice. Les réflexions des Romains sur leur propre religion à partir de la littérature antiquaire, 2007. (Mika Kajava)
  • C. M. C. Green: Roman Religion and the Cult of Diana at Aricia, 2007. (Marja-Leena Hänninen)
  • G. Max Bernheimer: Ancient Gems from the Borowski Collection, 2007. (Mika Kajava)
  • Hermanfrid Schubart – Gerta Maass-Lindemann: Toscanos 1967-1984. Toscanos. Die phönizische Niederlassung an der Mündung des Río de Vélez. Lieferung 2, 2007. (Mika Kajava)
  • Lisa C. Nevett: Domestic Space in Classical Antiquity, 2010. (Eeva-Maria Viitanen)
  • Kim Bowes: Houses and Society in the Later Roman Empire, 2010. (Eeva-Maria Viitanen)
  • Sheila Dillon: The Female Portrait Statue in the Greek World, 2012. (Margherita Carucci)
  • Corinna Riva: The Urbanisation of Etruria. Funerary Practices and Social Change, 700-600 BC., 2010. (Jorma Kaimio)
  • Maria Cristina Biella: Impasti orientalizzanti con decorazione ad incavo nell'Italia centrale tirrenica, Roma 2007. (Mika Kajava)
  • Maria Giuseppina Canosa: Una tomba principesca da Timmari, Roma 2007. (Mika Kajava)
  • Diana Spencer: Roman Landscape: Culture and Identity, 2011. (Eeva-Maria Viitanen)
  • Katherine E. Welch: The Roman Amphitheatre. From Its Origins to the Colosseum, 2007. (Leena Pietilä-Castrén)
  • Pompeii. Art, Industry and Infrastructure. Edited by Kevin Cole – Miko Flohr – Eric Poehler, 2011. (Eeva-Maria Viitanen)
  • Piano di Sorrento. Una storia di terra e di mare. A cura di Carlo Pepe e Felice Senatore, 2012. (Heikki Solin)
  • Minerva Medica in Valtrebbia. Scienze storiche e scienze naturali alleate per la scoperta del luogo di culto, 2008. (Heikki Solin)
